cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 miles ESE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Slow westward drift followed by a gradual turn toward the northwest, bringing the center toward the middle Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Matagorda Bay, TX (between Port Aransas and Freeport)

weather_observation.watch_coast: South of Port Aransas, TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, TX to Intracoastal City, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Port Mansfield, TX to Cameron, LA (storm-surge watch area) and adjacent western Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39+ mph) possible; 46 % cumulative chance, with a 14 % chance for 58+ mph gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation 2–4 ft above ground level in Corpus Christi and adjacent bays if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Long-lived event with 3–5 inches common and isolated totals near 10 inches; flash and urban flooding likely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; minor river flooding possible.
